headline: Coterra Energy downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Roth Capital
summary: Roth Capital downgraded Coterra Energy (CTRA) to Neutral from Buy with a price target of $28, down from $30. The firm believes that the company will not see a higher offer than that of Devon Energy (DVN) or a competing bidder at this time despite the “modestly disappointing” takeout price, the analyst tells investors in a research note. It would take a larger company to buy Coterra given its $25 billion enterprise value, and companies with Delaware Basin adjacency like ConocoPhilips (COP), Chevr

headline: Coterra Devon All Stock Merger Spurs Valuation And Governance Questions
summary: Coterra Energy (NYSE:CTRA) has agreed to a definitive all stock merger with Devon Energy, creating one of the largest U.S. shale oil producers. The combined company is expected to have a strong footprint in the Delaware Basin and other key shale regions. Leadership changes and an updated board structure are planned as part of the transaction. Several law firms have launched shareholder investigations into whether the merger terms are fair to Coterra investors. Coterra Energy focuses on oil...
